titleStmt.title: ¶The presentacyon and introyte of this present booke.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: ¶The presentacyon and introyte of this present booke.

monogr.title: Here endeth ye hystorye of Olyuer of Castylle, and of the fayre Helayne

div.head: ¶The presentacyon and introyte of this present booke.
div.p: TO the ryght holy and ryght well e • rous louynge and magnyfycence of oure saueoure Ihesu cryst / and of his ryght doulce and gloryous mod • r saynt Marye / the whiche ben the mocyons of all good operacyons / & with out the whiche none can be begonne nor ended. I Henry Watson apprentyse of London trustynge in the grace of god hathe enterprysed for to translate this present hystorye out of Frensshe in to Englysshe / oure moders tonge / at the cōmaundement of my worshypfull mayster Wynkyn de worde / not hauynge regarde for to laye it in another / or in more dyffused termes thā the frensshe doth specyfye / for in doynge so I myght lyghtly haue fayled. Wherfore I requyre all them that shall rede it / or that hereth it redde / for to holde for excused my lytell and obscure vnderstandynge. In praynge our lorde that he gyue me grace for to fynysshe it by suche maner that it may be pleasaunt and agreable / and profytable vnto the reders / and vnto the herers of the same. Amē.
